item.title: [Fixed] Thanks for Your Help! [Fixed]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Remove the following:

c2.teleportToX = 3102; c2.teleportToY = 9516;

And

c2.teleportToX = c.absX; c2.teleportToY = c.absY; c2.heightLevel = c.heightLevel;

Replace with:

c.getPA().spellTeleport(X, Y, Z);

Please note: you need to change the X, Y, Z values to the correct ones.

Read full topic

item.title: [Fixed] Thanks for Your Help! [Fixed]
item.dc:creator: @mrpopyman mrpopyman
item.description:
@mrpopyman wrote:

How would I do it for these commands?:

if(playerCommand.startsWith("jail")) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(5); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c2.teleportToX = 3102; c2.teleportToY = 9516; c2.Jail = true; c2.sendMessage("You have been jailed by "+c.playerName+""); c.sendMessage("Successfully Jailed "+c2.playerName+"."); } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }

if (playerCommand.equals("alltome")) { for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; c2.teleportToX = c.absX; c2.teleportToY = c.absY; c2.heightLevel = c.heightLevel; c2.sendMessage("Mass teleport to: " + c.playerName + ""); } } }

Read full topic

item.title: [Fixed] Thanks for Your Help! [Fixed]
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:547876”][quote author=sertan8 link=topic=666782.msg4458319#msg4458319 date=1416173402]
just add some timers, let the ints be called within your command and that’s it.
[/quote]
Nah that’s too much work…

There’s a command I (and most other servers have) called “::tele” that allows the user to teleport to a specific x & y coordinate. The command is used like this: ::tele 3098 4012.

Here is the code snippit for the command from my commands.java:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("tele")) { String[] arg = playerCommand.split(" "); if (arg.length > 3) c.getPA().movePlayer(Integer.parseInt(arg[1]),Integer.parseInt(arg[2]),Integer.parseInt(arg[3])); else if (arg.length == 3) c.getPA().movePlayer(Integer.parseInt(arg[1]),Integer.parseInt(arg[2]),c.heightLevel); }

All I want to do is add the teleport GFX to the command, meaning that every time I use it, my character does the teleport animation.

All help would be appreciated.
Thanks.

Okay OP, this is EXTREMELY DIFFICULT. I don’t think any of the staff at Jagex have even figured this out, but I got you covered.
In your code, you see where it says “c.getPA().movePlayer”?
I want you to (BE CAREFUL NOW, THIS IS WHERE IT GETS REAL) change that to “c.getPA().spellTeleport”. Make sure you change it both times you see it…

Now, compile your server.
All done. Enjoy your java guru status for following my directions*.
[size=1pt]*Java Guru badge not actually awarded for doing this.[/size][/quote]instructions unclear got dick stuck in compiler

Read full topic

item.title: [Fixed] Thanks for Your Help! [Fixed]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

sertan8:

just add some timers, let the ints be called within your command and that’s it.

Nah that’s too much work…

[quote=“mrpopyman, post:1, topic:547876”]There’s a command I (and most other servers have) called “::tele” that allows the user to teleport to a specific x & y coordinate. The command is used like this: ::tele 3098 4012.

Here is the code snippit for the command from my commands.java:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("tele")) { String[] arg = playerCommand.split(" "); if (arg.length > 3) c.getPA().movePlayer(Integer.parseInt(arg[1]),Integer.parseInt(arg[2]),Integer.parseInt(arg[3])); else if (arg.length == 3) c.getPA().movePlayer(Integer.parseInt(arg[1]),Integer.parseInt(arg[2]),c.heightLevel); }

All I want to do is add the teleport GFX to the command, meaning that every time I use it, my character does the teleport animation.

All help would be appreciated.
Thanks.[/quote]

Okay OP, this is EXTREMELY DIFFICULT. I don’t think any of the staff at Jagex have even figured this out, but I got you covered.
In your code, you see where it says “c.getPA().movePlayer”?
I want you to (BE CAREFUL NOW, THIS IS WHERE IT GETS REAL) change that to “c.getPA().spellTeleport”. Make sure you change it both times you see it…

Now, compile your server.
All done. Enjoy your java guru status for following my directions*.
[size=1pt]*Java Guru badge not actually awarded for doing this.[/size]
